assumption: National Mutual's 2 colocation data centers in Chicago suggest a regional concentration with potential single point of failure risk
basis: Both Primary DC (22 racks, $635K annual) and Secondary DC (6 racks, $113K annual) are located in Chicago, IL - same geographic region
validation_needed: Confirm exact facility locations and disaster recovery testing procedures

assumption: National Mutual has a hybrid hosting model with approximately 60% cloud/SaaS and 40% on-premises based on application analysis
basis: Counting applications by hosting type: 22 Cloud/SaaS applications vs 14 On-Prem/Hybrid applications from the inventory
validation_needed: Confirm actual workload distribution by compute/storage rather than application count

assumption: Critical insurance applications (Guidewire, Duck Creek, Majesco) will require specialized migration expertise due to industry-specific configurations
basis: These are core policy administration and claims management systems with high criticality ratings and significant user bases (700-1,500+ users each)
validation_needed: Assess customizations, integrations, and data dependencies for each core insurance platform

assumption: AWS spend of $3.4M annually suggests significant cloud workloads that will require cross-cloud migration to Azure
basis: $281K monthly AWS spend across 41 accounts indicates substantial cloud adoption beyond just SaaS applications
validation_needed: Detailed AWS service inventory and architecture assessment to understand migration complexity

assumption: Current 1-hour RPO/RTO targets are aggressive and may not be achievable during migration periods
basis: Hot DR strategy with Tier 2 classification and both DCs in same region suggests current setup may not meet stated targets during disruptions
validation_needed: Review DR test results and actual recovery times achieved in recent tests

assumption: Security tool consolidation will be required due to platform differences between buyer and seller
basis: National Mutual uses Check Point firewalls, IBM QRadar SIEM, RSA SecurID MFA vs Atlantic's Check Point, Microsoft Sentinel, Microsoft Authenticator - partial overlap but different platforms
validation_needed: Detailed security architecture comparison and integration requirements

assumption: National Mutual uses standard RFC1918 IP addressing (likely 10.x.x.x or 192.168.x.x ranges)
basis: Standard practice for enterprise networks of this size (1,812 employees, 12 locations)
validation_needed: IP address scheme documentation from network team

assumption: Multi-site WAN connectivity exists between 12 office locations
basis: Enterprise with 12 locations and centralized IT (121 staff) requires inter-site connectivity for shared services
validation_needed: WAN architecture documentation and circuit inventory

assumption: Check Point firewalls are deployed based on security tools inventory
basis: Document explicitly lists Check Point as the firewall solution
validation_needed: Check Point version, model, and configuration details

assumption: National Mutual has basic MFA coverage with RSA SecurID but likely incomplete deployment across all users and privileged accounts
basis: Document shows RSA SecurID as MFA solution but no coverage metrics provided. Insurance companies typically have partial MFA deployment, and RSA SecurID is often deployed for privileged users first
validation_needed: MFA coverage percentage across all users, privileged accounts, and critical applications

assumption: National Mutual requires SOC 2 Type II certification as an insurance company handling sensitive customer data
basis: Insurance companies typically require SOC 2 certification for customer trust and regulatory compliance. The company handles policy, claims, and billing data requiring security controls
validation_needed: Current SOC 2 certification status and any audit findings

assumption: National Mutual has basic backup encryption but may lack comprehensive data-at-rest encryption across all systems
basis: Zerto and Veeam backup solutions typically include encryption, but comprehensive database and file system encryption is not explicitly documented. Insurance companies handle sensitive data requiring encryption
validation_needed: Comprehensive encryption inventory including databases, file systems, and application-level encryption
